page.title: 20Women's Institute, Warbleton
page.content: Two independent groups of the WI are associated with Warbleton; one now with 31 members meeting afternoons and the other (the authors of this survey) having l5 members and meeting evenings. Both groups meet monthly in the Dunn Village Hall. Meetings usually consist of an invited speaker (with fees of Â£5-Â£10 plus expenses)on any subject except politics and religion,including in l985 nature, cookery,history and antiques. After a social break there is discussion of local social issues or wider regional, national or international issues of particular relevance to women.Only 3 of our members live in this Domesday area. Many members combine being housewives with part/full time jobs e.g.farmers wives, physiotherapy, secretaries,teaching, astronomy and ballet teacher to the Royal family.
